steps.title: Poggers is a way to show your surprise or excitement about something.
steps.content: Poggers is a way to show your surprise or excitement about something. Did your friend just make an amazing play in a game, or did you witness something spectacular in a gaming stream? Poggers is a simple but effective way to share this shock, excitement, and amazement, especially within the gaming community. [1] X Research source Poggers is a pretty niche slang word with deep ties to online gaming, so it‚Äôs mostly used within a gaming or streaming context. It can also be used when chatting with someone well-versed in gaming lingo.

steps.title: Poggers is a common emote used on the Twitch streaming platform.
steps.content: Poggers is a common emote used on the Twitch streaming platform. The poggers emote resembles Pepe the Frog (a green cartoon frog with large eyes and distinctive lips) looking surprised with his mouth wide open. Pepe is the star of several other popular Twitch emotes, including: [2] X Research source Pepehands: An emote of Pepe crying with his hands held up (used to express sadness) MonkaS: An emote of Pepe looking nervous while visibly sweating (used to express anxiety) Feelsbadman: An emote of Pepe looking bummed and disappointed (used to express disappointment) Feelsgoodman: An emote of Pepe looking happy (used to express happiness)

steps.title: Use poggers to show your shock or enthusiasm about something.
steps.content: Use poggers to show your shock or enthusiasm about something. Whether you‚Äôre playing games with friends or tuning into your favorite Twitch streamer, use poggers or the poggers emote to show how psyched or surprised you are. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe you managed to steal dragon, dude. That was so poggers‚Äù ‚ÄúThat play of the game was pretty poggers‚Äù

steps.title: Acknowledge that something is cool or neat with poggers.
steps.content: Acknowledge that something is cool or neat with poggers. If you‚Äôre chatting with a tech- or game-savvy friend, sprinkle the word poggers into your convos to express your approval or agreement. Person A: ‚ÄúWork was slow, so my manager let me early‚Äù Person B: ‚ÄúPoggers‚Äù Person A: ‚ÄúI thought I forgot to save my BG3 file, but auto-save really came in clutch üòå‚Äù Person B: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs so poggers‚Äù

steps.title: Poggers comes from the PogChamp emote.
steps.content: Poggers comes from the PogChamp emote. The PogChamp emote features the shocked expression of Ryan Gutierrez (also known as ‚ÄúGootecks‚Äù), which was clipped from a 2010 outtake video for the Cross Counter TV YouTube channel. The name ‚ÄúPogChamp‚Äù comes from a different Cross Counter TV video where Gutierrez and Mike Ross face off in a game of Pogs (also known as Milk Caps) to ultimately advertise a piece of merchandise for the Street Fighter franchise. At the end of the video , Gutierrez notably says the phrase ‚Äúpog champions.‚Äù [3] X Research source The PogChamp emote became a mainstay on Twitch starting in the early 2010s. Pogs were paper caps for a special milk drink called POG (which is short for passion-orange-guava), made by Haleakala Dairy. Pog caps came in all sorts of colors and designs and were popularly collected in the latter decades of the 20th century. [4] X Research source

steps.title: It became a mainstream Twitch emote in 2017.
steps.content: It became a mainstream Twitch emote in 2017. To this day, the poggers emote is still used to express shock and excitement by members of the Twitch community. [5] X Research source It‚Äôs even outlived the original PogChamp emote, which was removed from Twitch following a controversial statement made by Gutierrez during the 2021 Capitol Riots in the USA. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Poggers as a slang word was popularized by a meme-y tweet.
steps.content: Poggers as a slang word was popularized by a meme-y tweet. In July 2018 (after poggers was already an established Twitch emote), user cawayee made a Twitter post discussing how she‚Äôd sent a guy a sexy image of herself, only for him to respond with ‚Äúpoggers.‚Äù This is a great example of how poggers started to be used more conversationally (even for joke purposes).

steps.title: ‚ÄúMy Little Pogchamp‚Äù
steps.content: ‚ÄúMy Little Pogchamp‚Äù ‚ÄúMy Little Pogchamp‚Äù is a meme format from 2020 in which popular fictional characters (notably, protagonist Ryuko from the anime Kill la Kill ) tell the viewer ‚ÄúOkay, fine‚ÄîI guess you are my little pogchamp.‚Äù [7] X Research source

steps.title: PogU
steps.content: PogU PogU is another Twitch emote featuring Gutierrez making the same surprised/impressed expression as he does in PogChamp, only he‚Äôs facing straight ahead rather than to the side. Like PogChamp and Poggers, PogU is also used to show one‚Äôs enthusiasm. [8] X Research source

steps.title: KomodoHype
steps.content: KomodoHype After Twitch removed the well-known PogChamp emote from its platform, the company began looking for an adequate replacement. After creating a poll, an emote featuring a shocked/excited komodo dragon was designated as the PogChamp replacement. [9] X Research source On Twitch, this emote is known as KomodoHype. [10] X Research source
